title: Susanna Reid says Kevin Clifton suffered the 'real Strictly Come Dancing curse'
text:

Susanna Reid has claimed Kevin Clifton has fallen victim to what she's dubbed the "real Strictly Come Dancing curse".

The Good Morning Britain host, who was partnered with Kevin in 2013, said those that do well in the show one year always leave early the next.

Kevin won Strictly 2018 but with his partner Anneka Rice became the second pairing to leave the competition this year.

Writing for the Daily Mail, Susanna, 48, explained: "Ola Jordan lifted the glitterball with Chris Hollins in 2009 — and was voted off in the second week in 2010.

"In 2011 Aliona Vilani won with Harry Judd and in 2012 she had to retire early after a training accident.

(Image: PA)

(Image: PA)

"The year I took part, Aljaz Skorjanec won with Abbey Clancy, the next year he finished tenth. Celebs: if your pro just won the show, the Strictly curse may waltz off with your dreams before you’ve even got going."

But her theory doesn't work for her own Strictly era, as Kevin and Susanna were the runners up in 2013 and he was a runner up again the following year.

Before the current series started, Kevin reportedly predicted that he would be leaving early.

(Image: PA)

This proved to be the case as Anneka's Charleston failed to capture the imagination of either the judges or the viewers at home.

The routine only managed to reap 11 points out of a possible 40 and judge Bruno Tonioli said Anneka had "slaughtered" the Kill Bill themed routine.

Following the announcement that Anneka had lost out to former England goalkeeper David James, with his pro partner Nadiya Bychkova, in the dance-off, Kevin was reportedly overheard saying to his fellow dancers, "I told you so."

(Image: BBC)

A show insider told The Sun: "Kevin adores Anneka as a person but professionally he knew his chances of making another final were over, especially as she’s struggled with injury and fitness."

The source continued: "All is not lost for Kevin though as he apparently has "a friend for life in Anneka and he loved working with her."

Kevin will not bow out of Strictly completely though as he will now participate in group dances and the pros’ performances.
